titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3192) to provide for a temporary safe harbor from the enforcement of integrated disclosure requirements for mortgage loan transactions under the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act of 1974 and the Truth in Lending Act, and for other purposes, and providing for proceedings during the period from October 12, 2015, through October 19, 2015.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3192) to provide for a temporary safe harbor from the enforcement of integrated disclosure requirements for mortgage loan transactions under the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act of 1974 and the Truth in Lending Act, and for other purposes, and providing for proceedings during the period from October 12, 2015, through October 19, 2015.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-289, by Mr. Stivers.
Resolution also provides for proceedings during the period from Oct. 12, 2015 through Oct. 19, 2015.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 64.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 462.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by voice vote.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on the H. Res. 462, the Chair put the question on adoption of the resolution and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair announced that further proceedings on the question of adoption of the resolution would be postponed until a time to be announced.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 238 - 181 (Roll no. 537).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3192) to provide for a temporary safe harbor from the enforcement of integrated disclosure requirements for mortgage loan transactions under the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act of 1974 and the Truth in Lending Act, and for other purposes, and providing for proceedings during the period from October 12, 2015, through October 19, 2015.
